original_title: Landmarks of Western Art: From Rococo to Revolution - A Journey of Art History
overview: Following the development of non-secular art in the seventeenth century, the world of art in the eighteenth century assumed a more decorative role with a greater emphasis on pastoral themes. This episode features the work of Watteau, Boucher, Hogarth, Gainsborough and Reynolds.
title: Landmarks of Western Art: From Rococo to Revolution - A Journey of Art History
